sentences.en: After a short march, the column entered the village.
sentences.cn: 短途行军后，队伍进了村。

sentences.en: An estimated 5,000 people marched through the city to demonstrate against the factory closures.
sentences.cn: 大约有五千人在市里游行示威，抗议关闭工厂。

sentences.en: Aston Villa last led the League in March 1990.
sentences.cn: 阿斯顿维拉队上一次赢得联赛冠军是在1990年3月。

sentences.en: Both were remanded on bail by Wrexham magistrates until March 24.
sentences.cn: 两个人都被雷克瑟姆的地方治安官批准保释，直到3月24日审判。

sentences.en: But as other shops fold, the march of the superstores continues.
sentences.cn: 但在其他商店纷纷关门倒闭之时，大型超市的强劲扩张势头却依旧不减。

sentences.en: His case comes before an industrial tribunal in March.
sentences.cn: 他的讼案将于3月在劳资法庭受审。

sentences.en: I read Germaine Greer's article in the March issue with particular interest.
sentences.cn: 我饶有兴致地阅读了杰曼·格里尔在三月那期发表的文章。

sentences.en: In March 1770, there occurred what became known as the Boston Massacre.
sentences.cn: 1770年3月在那里发生了后来闻名的波士顿惨案。

sentences.en: It is easy to feel trampled by the relentless march of technology.
sentences.cn: 随着科技发展的日新月异，人们容易感到无所适从。

sentences.en: On 29 August the royal army marched into Inverness.
sentences.cn: 8月29日皇家军队开进因弗内斯。

sentences.en: She was born in Austria on March 6, 1920.
sentences.cn: 她于1920年3月6日出生在奥地利。

sentences.en: She was born in March and christened in June.
sentences.cn: 她3月出生，6月受洗。

sentences.en: Sow the seed in a warm place in February/March.
sentences.cn: 2月或3月里把种子播种在温暖的地方。

sentences.en: Tarleton's men had been on the march for much of the night.
sentences.cn: 塔尔顿的士兵几乎整晚都在行军。

sentences.en: Technology is on the march.
sentences.cn: 科学技术在进步

sentences.en: The change proposed last month was foreshadowed in the March Budget.
sentences.cn: 上个月提议的变动在3月份的预算中已经有所预兆了。

sentences.en: The general led his forces on a long march southwards.
sentences.cn: 将军率领他的军队朝南长途行军。

sentences.en: The Kingdom of Italy formally came into being on 17 March 1861.
sentences.cn: 意大利王国于1861年3月17日正式成立。

sentences.en: The police decided not to ban the march.
sentences.cn: 警方决定不禁止这次示威游行。

sentences.en: The role is played by seventeen-year-old Briton Jane March.
sentences.cn: 这个角色由17岁的英国人简·马奇扮演。

words.tran_cn: 行军，进军；进行曲；示威游行

phrases.tran_cn: 行进，向前进；向…推进；进入检阅场地

phrases.phrase: march to (the beat) of a different tune (或 drummer
phrases.tran_cn: (非正式)（方法或观点）与众不同；不同寻常
偷偷抢在前面：赶在…前面，尤其是通过私下的冒险行为

trans.tran_cn: 游行示威，行进，进步，进行曲
trans.tran_en: an organized event in which many people walk together to express their ideas or protest about something
if soldiers or other people march somewhere, they walk there quickly with firm regular steps

trans.tran_cn: 行军，前进，示威游行，行走，迫使…同行
trans.tran_en: if soldiers or other people march somewhere, they walk there quickly with firm regular steps
if soldiers or other people march somewhere, they walk there quickly with firm regular steps
